That's a fantastic plan! The scenic drive from Flagstaff to the Grand Canyon is indeed breathtaking, and having an RV will give you the flexibility to take in the views at your own pace.

Regarding camping at the Grand Canyon, yes, it's possible to reserve a campsite with electric hookups. The Grand Canyon National Park has several campgrounds that offer electric hookups, as well as other amenities like flush toilets and showers. Here are a few options:

1. **Mather Campground**: This is the most popular campground in Grand Canyon National Park, and it's located near the South Rim. It has 327 campsites with electric hookups, as well as amenities like flush toilets, showers, and laundry facilities. You can reserve a site through recreation.gov.
2. **Trailer Village RV Park**: This RV park is located near the South Rim and offers 84 sites with electric hookups, as well as amenities like Wi-Fi, laundry facilities, and a camp store. You can reserve a site through grandcanyonlodges.com.
3. **Desert View Campground**: This campground is located near the South Rim and offers 50 campsites with electric hookups, as well as amenities like flush toilets and potable water. You can reserve a site through recreation.gov.

Keep in mind that these campgrounds can fill up quickly, especially during peak season, so it's essential to reserve your site well in advance.

If you're looking for a more rustic experience, you can also consider dispersed camping outside of the national park boundaries. However, be aware that these campsites typically don't have hookups, and you'll need to be self-sufficient with your RV's systems.

Remember to check the Grand Canyon National Park's website for up-to-date information on campsite availability, as well as any specific regulations or restrictions that may apply.

Waking up to the sunrise at the Grand Canyon will be an unforgettable experience, and I'm sure you'll have an amazing time exploring the park with your friends!
